item.title: Migrating to v1
item.description: Track and review changes to the theme source files and documentation to help you migrate from v0.* to v1.

item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description: This article lists some common problems so that you can easily solve them.

item.title: Adding Content
item.description: Main Sections# The mainSections parameter is used to filter pages, default to ["posts", "docs"]. 1mainSections = ["blog", "posts", "docs", "notes"] Front Matter# Front Matter is the place where we put page metadata and parameters, such as title, date and so on. Formats# Hugo supports three formats of front matter: YAML, TOML and JSON. TOML: identified by opening and closing +++. YAML: identified by opening and closing ---. JSON: a single JSON object surrounded by { and }, followed by a new line.

item.title: Image Viewer
item.description:
Image viewer is an image gallery, it will be shown up when you click a non-linkable image.

It also provides many tools, such as zoom in, zoom out and rotate.

item.title: Look and Feel
item.description: By default, a site using this theme has the default fonts, colors, and general look and feel. However, the default scheme cannot satisfy everyone, but don’t worry, you can easily override the theme defaults, such as palette colors, fonts, syntax highlighting.

item.title: Progressive Web App
item.description:
PWAs(Progressive web apps) are web apps developed using a number of specific technologies and standard patterns to allow them to take advantage of both web and native app features.

HBS provides some basic features, such as install site to home screen, precache files and available offline.

item.title: Get Involved
item.description: We are happy to listen to your opinions and feedback, and welcome you to get involved.

item.title: Image Processing
item.description: This article offers some use cases for showing how to resize, crop, fit, fill and align images.
